[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Schema evolution] [Metadata schema changes] If DbMetadataSchema or InternalIndexerMetadataSchema is updated in a future version, can old EventStorePruner code still read/write metadata correctly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Schema evolution] [Backwards compatibility] If a node is upgraded to a new version with modified pruning logic, can it correctly handle progress metadata written by the old version? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Schema evolution] [Migration safety] During schema migration, can EventStorePruner accidentally prune data that needs to be migrated, causing data loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Edge cases] [Zero version] Does the pruner handle version 0 correctly, or are there special cases for genesis that need different handling? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Edge cases] [Empty events] If some versions have zero events, does prune_event_indices return an empty array for those versions? Can this cause errors in prune_events when it expects non-empty data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Edge cases] [Maximum events] If a malicious transaction emits the maximum possible number of events, can this cause the num_events_per_version vector at line 55-59 to consume excessive memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Edge cases] [Progress equals target] If current_progress already equals target_version when prune() is called, does the function return immediately or attempt to prune an empty range? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Edge cases] [One version pruning] If pruning a single version (target_version = current_progress + 1), are all code paths tested for this minimal case? Can off-by-one errors occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Cross-pruner interaction] [Shared metadata] Does EventStorePruner share any metadata or resources with other sub-pruners (TransactionPruner, WriteSetPruner, etc.)? Can their concurrent operations cause conflicts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Cross-pruner interaction] [Progress synchronization] If EventStorePruner falls behind other sub-pruners in progress, can this create inconsistencies where transactions are pruned but their events remain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Cross-pruner interaction] [Dependency ordering] Are there dependencies between pruners where EventStorePruner must complete before or after other pruners? Can violation of this ordering cause data integrity issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Cross-pruner interaction] [Resource contention] Can concurrent execution of all sub-pruners via par_iter() cause resource contention (CPU, disk I/O, memory) that degrades overall system performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Type safety] [Version type consistency] Are Version types used consistently throughout? Can type confusion between u64 and Version lead to incorrect comparisons or arithmetic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Type safety] [Result handling] Are all Result types properly handled with ? operator or explicit error checking? Can unwrap() calls hide potential panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Type safety] [Option unwrapping] Besides expect_indexer_db() at line 27-31, are there other locations where Option types are unsafely unwrapped without proper validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Observability] [Progress logging] The info! log at line 101-105 logs catch-up progress. Is there sufficient logging during normal prune() operations to diagnose issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Observability] [Error logging] When prune() returns an error, is sufficient context logged to diagnose the root cause, or does the error propagate silently? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Observability] [Metrics] Are there metrics exposed for monitoring EventStorePruner health (e.g., pruning rate, errors, progress lag)? Can operators detect pruner failures before they cause issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Database] [RocksDB consistency] Does EventStorePruner rely on any RocksDB-specific consistency guarantees? Can switching to a different storage backend break pruning logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Database] [Column family isolation] Are EventSchema, EventByKeySchema, and EventByVersionSchema in separate column families? Can pruning one without the others cause consistency issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Database] [Compaction interference] Can RocksDB compaction operations interfere with pruning, potentially causing performance degradation or data consistency issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Database] [Write amplification] Does the pruning strategy minimize write amplification? Can excessive pruning cause disk wear or performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/pruner/ledger_pruner/event_store_pruner.rs] [Event security] [Critical event preservation] Are there critical system events (e.g., governance events, validator set changes) that should never be pruned? Does EventStorePruner distinguish these? (High)
